meta.content: Through a partnership with the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, the United Community Center operates a K4 - 8th grade charter school within its campus. Also offered is an Early Childhood Education Program for 3-year-olds to prepare them early for academic success.

Through a partnership with the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, the United Community Center operates a K4 - 8th grade charter school within its campus. Also offered is an Early Childhood Education Program for 3-year-olds to prepare them early for academic success.

div.div: ALL UCC Schools are CLOSED until further notice as mandated by Governor Evers. This includes ALL after-school activities. Check ClassDojo for updates.

div.p: ALL UCC Schools are CLOSED until further notice due to the spread of coronavirus as mandated by Governor Evers. This includes ALL after-school programs, activities and sports. Please check ClassDojo for updates. Thank you.

Through a partnership with the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, the United Community Center operates a K4 - 8th grade charter school within its campus. Also offered is an Early Childhood Education Program for 3-year-olds to prepare them early for academic success.
Bruce-Guadalupe received a 4-Star Rating of Exceeds Expectations on the Wisconsin School Report Card.

Our Early Childhood Education Program has a 5 STAR rating from YoungStar and the Wisconsin Department of Children and Families, the highest possible rating. Our dedicated staff provides top rated care and education for our youngest students!
Follow our teachers on Instagram and Twitter using #bgcsedu

p.br: You will be prompted to select the building your child is in. Leave a message with your child's name, teacher, and grade, explaining the reason for the absence.

li.a: UCC Inclement Weather Policy & Procedures ( In English & Español)

div.p: Bruce-Guadalupe Community School could not operate without its dedicated, passionate, and hard-working teachers and faculty members! They're the backbone of our schools as well as our communities. If you're trying to contact your child's teacher, a staff member, or a member of our administration, you can find her or his email address in one of our staff directories.

The library media program at Bruce-Guadalupe is based on the concept of free access to information that reflects the cultural diversity and the pluralistic nature of a global society. This free access is available to all students and staff.
